title: Exhaust Secondary Silencer - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Note the position and orientation of exhaust clamps prior to releasing them.
Loosen the clamp securing the silencer to the primary silencer.
Supporting the silencer, release the fixing and collect the lock nut and washer. Discard the lock nut.
Remove the fixing, making sure that the flanged sleeves remain situated in the bush. If the flanged sleeves are removed, note their orientation for assembly.
Remove the silencer from the catalytic converter.
Remove the clamp and the gasket. Discard the gasket.
